title: Adaptations of insects. - 2nd ed.
brief_description: Shows the ways in which insects are adapted to their environments. Considers the functions of legs, mouths, breathing organs and camouflage in allowing the various insects to survive in the particular environments. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.
